#summary Frequently Asked Questions
<dl>
<dt>*How does Chromey Calculator work?*
<dd>All results for Chromey Calculator are generated using [http://www.google.com/help/calculator.html Google's calculator] web search feature or [http://www.wolframalpha.com/ Wolfram|Alpha]. When Google fails to find a result for a an input query, it gets sent on to Wolfram|Alpha.

<dt>*Why don't I see any result when I press "="?*
<dd>To get a result, you must press _Enter_. You can add an "=" to the end of an expression, but it is not necessary.

<dt>*What kinds of calculations is Chromey Calculator capable of?*
<dd>Since Chromey Calculator uses Google's calculator feature, it can do anything [http://www.google.com/help/calculator.html Google calculator] can do. It can also handle quite a few Wolfram|Alpha queries.

<dt>*What kinds of names are allowed for user variables?*
<dd>User variables must start with an "@" sign followed by one or more letters, numbers, or underscores. The "@" variable is reserved for storing the most recent result.
